channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Dumped rubbish, 5th September
item.description:
Rubbish dumped outside 110 Wigmore Street

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 110-116, Wigmore Street, Mayfair, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Massive dip in the road, 5th September
item.description:
There has recently been a new crossing installed outside 5 Brackley Road (Randmore Court). As part of this, tarmac was used to fill in some holes in the road when the work was being completed. This tarmac has now significantly sunk, and there is a massive dip in the road posing a massive risk to drivers. Please fix immediately
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 5, Brackley Road, New Beckenham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rubbish on footpath, 5th September
item.description:
Please tell charity it must empty daily or remove this bin. It is a health hazard and near to pub and school. Take action! Thanks

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 187a, Friern Road, East Dulwich, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Trees blocking the street lights on the Meadowview road end of the river path, 5th September
item.description:
The two street lights at the Meadowview Road end of the river path are completely blocked by the overgrown trees. Please can this be cut back? It's getting dark earlier now and it's been like this for sometime. Thanks
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Meadowview Road, New Beckenham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dumped wheelclamped, 5th September
item.description:
At least six months ago someone around here was clamped, they cut it off their vehicle and dumped it against the lamppost outside number 59 Weir Hall Road, N18 1EL. Is there any chance of someone getting rid of it please?...it has been there months and months.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Weir Hall Avenue, Bowes, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly tipping, 5th September
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 196-200, Shooters Hill Road, Blackheath, London

item.title: Central manhole cover loud banging, 5th September
item.description:
When heavy vehicles drive over this bangs loudly and is disturbing for the residents opposite

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 525, Old Kent Road, Old Kent Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Street cleaners.....?????, 5th September
item.description:
Just wondering what happened to the street cleaners again this week, or if you did come, why you left stuff! (Perhaps you were busy on the phone again ðŸ¤”) Aside from various other crap I'll just give you a couple of highlights. Two empty 2 litre soft drink bottles along with a discarded takeaway food black carrier bag that the birds and foxes have had a good go at since last Friday, is still there, as is the three empty wine bottles on the roundabout which have been there since Monday or Tuesday. There was a lot of litter at the entrance to the Weir Hall Avenue cul de sac which has now gone so he must of missed the rest of he was 'sidetracked' again ðŸ“³ðŸ¤”!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bowes, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dead cat in the road, 5th September
item.description:
There is a dead cat in the road at the top of the alley near 1 Saxville Road. I have moved it onto the grass verge to avoid it getting squashed

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Saxville Road, St Paul's Cray, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Do not remove flags, 5th September
item.description:
These flags were NOT put up as an act of racism, hatred, or to intimidate, they are symbols of the country we are living in. Tell me why England isn't allowed to fly an English flag but other countries can fly theirs here? If people are offended, that's on them, I dont want people being offended for me.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Sevenoaks Way, St Paul's Cray, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Footpath completely blocked by YF72MXY. This is a serious safety issue for the vulnerable disabled, partially sighted, visually impaired and children who cannot pass without hitting the obstruction or going into the road. Bromley Council's inaction means they will be culpable for any accidents to these vulnerable pedestrians. Blocked 06:30 05/09/25. Blocked overnight and every morning., 5th September
